name: AI Foundry Classification Triage Agent
description: An intelligent incident classification and triage agent powered by Azure AI Foundry. Specializes in analyzing customer issues, classifying incidents into proper categories, assessing priority levels, and routing cases to appropriate teams using ServiceNow standards.

skills.name: Incident Classification
skills.description: Classify customer incidents into categories such as Fraud, Technical Issues, Payment Issues, Card Issues, Account Services, Security, and Inquiries
examples: I lost my card while traveling
There is an unauthorized charge on my account
I cannot log into my banking app
My payment failed to go through

skills.name: Priority Assessment
skills.description: Determine urgency, impact, and priority levels for incidents using ServiceNow standard mapping
examples: Assess priority for fraud incident
Determine urgency for account blocked
Evaluate impact of system outage
Calculate priority matrix for technical issue

skills.name: Routing & Triage
skills.description: Route incidents to appropriate teams and provide triage recommendations based on classification
examples: Route fraud case to security team
Escalate critical payment issue
Assign technical issue to IT support
Triage account service request

skills.name: ServiceNow Field Mapping
skills.description: Map incident details to proper ServiceNow fields including category, subcategory, description, and metadata
examples: Map incident to ServiceNow fields
Generate proper short description
Categorize into subcategory
Create structured ticket data

skills.name: Keyword Analysis
skills.description: Analyze customer messages for classification keywords and context cues to determine incident type
examples: Analyze message for fraud keywords
Identify technical issue indicators
Extract payment problem signals
Detect security concerns

name: AI Foundry Deep Search Knowledge Agent
description: An intelligent customer support agent powered by Azure AI Foundry with deep search capabilities through comprehensive support documentation covering account management, billing, payments, fraud protection, and technical support.

skills.name: Document Search
skills.description: Deep search through customer support documents including account management, billing, payments, complaints, and technical support
examples: How do I close my account?
What are the fees for wire transfers?
How to dispute a charge on my account?
What do I do if I suspect fraud on my card?

skills.name: Account Support
skills.description: Comprehensive support for account opening, closure, and management procedures
examples: Steps to open a new account
Account closure procedures
Required documents for account setup
Account management best practices

skills.name: Billing & Payments
skills.description: Information about billing, payments, fees, and charges
examples: Understanding monthly fees
Payment methods and options
How to set up automatic payments
Fee schedule and billing cycle information

skills.name: Fraud & Security
skills.description: Guidance on fraud prevention, unauthorized transactions, and security measures
examples: What to do if my card is stolen
Reporting unauthorized transactions
Security features and protections
Fraud prevention tips

skills.name: Technical Support
skills.description: Online banking, mobile app, and technical assistance
examples: Online banking login issues
Mobile app troubleshooting
Password reset procedures
Technical feature guidance

name: Sentiment Analysis Agent
description: This agent determines the sentiment of a customer given context, and personalizes the experience based on sentiment and context.

skills.name: Sentiment Analysis Tool
skills.description: Analyzes the sentiment of a customer given context and personalizes the experience based on sentiment and context.
examples: How does the customer feel about our service?
Analyze the sentiment of this feedback: "I love the new features!"
What is the mood of this message: "I am frustrated with the wait time."

name: ServiceNow, Web & Knowledge Agent
description: An intelligent agent specialized in ServiceNow management, Bank system actions, web search, and file/knowledge/document search.

skills.name: ServiceNow Management
skills.description: Create, search, and manage ServiceNow incidents, users, and knowledge base articles. Simulates ServiceNow actions with realistic synthetic data.
examples: Create a new ServiceNow incident
Search for incidents assigned to a user
Update incident status
List ServiceNow users
Search ServiceNow knowledge base

skills.name: Bank Actions
skills.description: Simulate any action on the Bank system (block/unblock card, check balance, report fraud, create disputes, issue refunds, etc.) and return synthetic responses.
examples: Block a credit card
Unblock a credit card
Check account balance
Report a fraudulent transaction
Create a dispute for a transaction
Issue a refund for a transaction
Check transaction details

skills.name: Web Search
skills.description: Search the web for current information using Bing or other integrated search tools.
examples: Find the latest news about a company
Search for troubleshooting steps online
Get current weather information

skills.name: File & Knowledge Search
skills.description: Search through uploaded documents, files, and knowledge bases for specific information.
examples: Search uploaded PDF for a keyword
Find information in a user manual
Extract data from a document

skills.name: Human Expert Escalation
skills.description: Escalate complex issues to human experts or facilitate human-in-the-loop interactions when automated responses are insufficient.
examples: Escalate this issue to a human expert
I need to speak with a person
Request human assistance for complex decision
Connect me with a human agent

name: SportsResultAgent
description: This agent provides sports results for various sports leagues such as MLB, NBA, NASCAR, and Golf.

skills.name: Sports Results Agent
skills.description: Provides sports results from various sports leagues. Include scores, who won, and other relevant information.
examples: Show score for Pirates game last night
What was the final score of the game 7 NBA finals and who won?
Who won the 2025 US Golf Open Championship and where was it played?

name: AI Foundry Claims Specialist Agent
description: An intelligent multi-line claims specialist powered by Azure AI Foundry. Provides coverage validation, settlement calculations, documentation checklists, and compliance guidance across auto, property, travel, and health insurance claims.

skills.name: Auto Claims Assessment
skills.description: Evaluate auto insurance losses, apply deductibles, total loss thresholds, and rental allowances using auto_claims.md guidance.
examples: My car was rear-ended and the repair shop quoted $6,500. How much will insurance cover?
Do I get a rental car while my vehicle is repaired?
The thief stole my car and it was recovered with damage—what happens next?
Is hail damage covered under my comprehensive policy?

skills.name: Property Claims Management
skills.description: Guide homeowners and property claims: covered perils, mitigation steps, documentation, and settlement math from home_claims.md.
examples: A pipe burst in my basement and ruined the flooring—what documentation do you need?
There was a kitchen fire; how do I calculate depreciation on cabinetry?
Do I have coverage for wind damage to my roof?
What temporary housing benefits apply during repairs?

skills.name: Travel Claim Support
skills.description: Assess trip cancellation, baggage, and emergency medical claims using travel_claims.md coverage and exclusions.
examples: I had to cancel my trip because I was hospitalized—can I get reimbursed?
My luggage was delayed for two days; what can I claim?
What proof is required for emergency evacuation abroad?
Does a government travel advisory trigger cancellation coverage?

skills.name: Health Claim Guidance
skills.description: Explain deductibles, coinsurance, and documentation needs for medical claims per health_claims.md.
examples: How much will I owe for a $12,000 inpatient surgery?
Is my specialty medication covered and what is the copay?
Do emergency out-of-network services get paid at in-network rates?
What documents are required for a maternity claim?

skills.name: Documentation & Compliance
skills.description: Provide required forms, fraud checks, and regulatory timelines using universal_claims.md, procedures_faq.md, and regulatory_compliance.md.
examples: What documents do I submit for a coordinated benefits claim?
How quickly must I report a loss to stay within policy guidelines?
What red flags should I be aware of for potential fraud escalation?
How do we communicate claim denials while staying compliant?

name: AI Foundry Assessment & Estimation Agent
description: An intelligent assessment specialist powered by Azure AI Foundry. Performs multi-line damage evaluations, cost estimations, and structured reporting for auto, property, travel, and health scenarios.

skills.name: Auto Damage Assessment
skills.description: Analyze collision/comprehensive losses, estimate labor/materials, and recommend severity using auto_estimation.md tables.
examples: Front bumper and headlight replacement – provide estimated cost and labor hours
Hail damage across hood and roof – severity and paint estimate
Flooded SUV interior – determine total loss threshold
Rear-end collision with airbags deployed – labor/material cost breakdown

skills.name: Property Damage Estimation
skills.description: Assess dwelling and contents losses, apply depreciation, and flag mitigation steps per property_estimation.md.
examples: Basement flood affecting drywall and flooring – provide estimated repair cost
Kitchen fire damaging cabinets and appliances – breakdown labor vs materials
Windstorm removing 30% of roof shingles – estimate replacement cost
Contents smoke damage – calculate ACV vs replacement cost

skills.name: Travel Loss Estimation
skills.description: Estimate trip interruption, baggage loss, and medical evacuation costs using travel_estimation.md benchmarks.
examples: Trip cancellation due to illness – estimate reimbursable costs
Lost baggage including laptop and clothing – provide replacement value
Medical emergency abroad – estimate ER, hospital, and evacuation costs
Cruise interruption – calculate prorated trip value

skills.name: Health Cost Estimation
skills.description: Estimate medical service costs, bundled treatments, and specialist visits using health_estimation.md guidance.
examples: Appendectomy with 3-day stay – estimate total cost range
MRI plus specialist consult – provide bundled estimate
ER visit for stitches and X-ray – calculate typical charges
Specialty drug therapy – monthly cost range

skills.name: Estimation Quality & QA
skills.description: Apply universal estimation workflow, depreciation rules, and QA checklists from universal_estimation.md and procedures_faq.md.
examples: Provide step-by-step assessment workflow for new assignment
Apply depreciation to electronics and furniture for contents loss
Explain severity categorization based on cost thresholds
List QA checklist items before submitting estimate report

name: AI Foundry Fraud Intelligence Agent
description: An intelligent fraud specialist powered by Azure AI Foundry. Evaluates claims for red flags, organizes evidence, and recommends SIU escalation across auto, property, travel, and health domains.

skills.name: Auto Fraud Detection
skills.description: Identify staged collisions, inflated injuries, and documentation anomalies using fraud_auto.md guidance.
examples: Low-speed collision with high medical bills—evaluate fraud indicators
Vehicle theft claim with missing keys—outline red flags
Multiple prior auto claims in 18 months—assess escalation needs
Handwritten repair receipts with inconsistencies—flag concerns

skills.name: Property Fraud Detection
skills.description: Spot intentional fire, inflated contents, and contractor fraud patterns per fraud_property.md.
examples: Fire shortly after coverage increase—analyze red flags
Contents claim with no receipts—evaluate fraud risk
Roof claim citing sudden damage—compare against fraud indicators
Contractor estimate triple market rate—recommend actions

skills.name: Travel Fraud Detection
skills.description: Detect forged medical notes, baggage padding, and duplicate cancellations using fraud_travel.md.
examples: Trip cancellation with questionable medical note—verify fraud signs
Lost baggage claim with luxury items—assess proof requirements
Duplicate receipts across travelers—highlight escalation triggers
Trip booked then cancelled immediately—identify scheme type

skills.name: Health Fraud Screening
skills.description: Analyze phantom billing, upcoding, and prescription anomalies per fraud_health.md.
examples: Provider billing 15 MRIs in one day—summarize red flags
Out-of-network surgery with inflated rates—flag investigation steps
Frequent prescription refills—recommend monitoring actions
Elective procedure coded as emergency—assess documentation gaps

skills.name: Fraud Workflow & Escalation
skills.description: Apply universal fraud red flags, anomaly patterns, and SIU referral rules from fraud_universal.md and fraud_procedures_faq.md.
examples: Compile fraud evidence summary for SIU referral
Determine if multiple red flags trigger escalation
Outline documentation needed before escalating
Explain fraud ring indicators in cluster of claims

name: Legal Compliance & Regulatory Agent
description: An intelligent legal and compliance agent specialized in regulatory analysis, risk assessment, document analysis, and incident response. Can analyze compliance requirements for GDPR, SOX, CCPA and other regulations, assess legal risks, research regulatory requirements, analyze legal documents, handle incident reporting, search the web for current legal information, and search through uploaded legal documents and compliance materials, all with professional legal guidance.

skills.name: Legal Compliance
skills.description: Analyze compliance requirements for specific regulations (GDPR, SOX, CCPA, etc.) and provide regulatory guidance.
examples: Assess GDPR compliance for data processing
Conduct SOX compliance audit
Evaluate CCPA compliance requirements
Analyze regulatory requirements for a business activity

skills.name: Risk Assessment
skills.description: Assess legal and compliance risks for business activities and provide mitigation strategies.
examples: Assess legal risks for a new business activity
Evaluate compliance risks for data processing
Provide risk mitigation strategies
Conduct regulatory risk assessment

skills.name: Regulatory Research
skills.description: Research specific regulations and their requirements using legal databases and web search.
examples: Research GDPR Article 6 requirements
Find SOX Section 404 compliance requirements
Look up CCPA data subject rights
Research regulatory guidance for data transfers

skills.name: Document Analysis
skills.description: Analyze legal documents, contracts, and compliance materials for regulatory requirements.
examples: Analyze privacy policy for GDPR compliance
Review data processing agreement
Assess contract for regulatory requirements
Analyze compliance documentation

skills.name: Incident Response
skills.description: Handle data breach and compliance incident reporting with proper procedures.
examples: Create data breach incident report
Generate compliance violation report
Provide incident response procedures
Assess incident severity and impact

skills.name: Web Search
skills.description: Search the web for current legal and regulatory information using Bing or other integrated search tools.
examples: Find latest regulatory updates
Search for legal precedents
Get current compliance guidance
Research regulatory enforcement actions

skills.name: File & Knowledge Search
skills.description: Search through uploaded legal documents, compliance materials, and knowledge bases for specific information.
examples: Search legal documents for specific requirements
Find compliance guidance in uploaded materials
Extract regulatory information from documents
Search through compliance policies

name: AI Foundry Image Generator Agent
description: An Azure AI Foundry agent that can generate and edit images.

skills.name: Generate Image
skills.description: Create new images from text prompts with various styles, subjects, and compositions.
examples: Generate a mountain landscape with a dog
Create a product visualization for marketing materials
Design concept art for a fantasy scene
Produce an image matching specific brand guidelines

skills.name: Edit Image
skills.description: Modify existing images through inpainting, outpainting, style transfer, or targeted edits.
examples: Remove background from an image
Change the color scheme of an existing image
Add or remove objects from a scene
Extend an image beyond its original boundaries

name: AI Foundry Image Analysis Agent
description: Analyzes images using Azure AI Foundry with GPT-4o vision.

skills.name: Image Analysis
skills.description: Analyze images using GPT-4o vision capabilities.
examples: Analyze this vehicle damage photo
What do you see in this image?
Describe what is shown in this picture
What issues or concerns are visible here?
Tell me about this image

name: AI Consulting Interview Agent
description: An intelligent interview agent that conducts consultative discovery conversations to qualify leads for AI consulting services. Asks probing questions to understand business challenges, technical context, stakeholders, and implementation requirements. Designed to build rapport while systematically gathering the information needed to provide valuable recommendations.

skills.name: Lead Qualification Interview
skills.description: Conduct consultative interviews to understand customer AI and automation needs, gather comprehensive information about their business challenges, and qualify leads for AI consulting services
examples: I want to learn more about AI solutions for my business
Can you help me understand what AI could do for my company?
We need to automate some of our business processes
Tell me about your AI consulting services

skills.name: Business Needs Assessment
skills.description: Deep-dive into customer business challenges, pain points, and opportunities for AI implementation. Probes for technical context, scale, timeline, and success criteria
examples: What questions do you need to ask to understand my AI needs?
Help me articulate what I need from an AI solution
We have a problem but don't know if AI can help

skills.name: Technical Environment Discovery
skills.description: Gather information about current technology stack, data infrastructure, team capabilities, and technical constraints to assess implementation feasibility
examples: What do you need to know about our technical setup?
We use Azure and have data in SQL databases
Our team has limited AI experience

skills.name: Stakeholder & Decision Process Mapping
skills.description: Identify key stakeholders, decision-makers, budget owners, and approval processes to ensure proper engagement and follow-up
examples: Who needs to be involved in evaluating AI solutions?
What's the approval process for this type of project?
I need to get buy-in from multiple departments

skills.name: Consultation Scheduling & Next Steps
skills.description: Summarize gathered information, suggest appropriate next steps, and coordinate follow-up consultations with AI specialists
examples: What are the next steps after this conversation?
Can you schedule a consultation with an AI specialist?
I'd like to move forward with exploring this
